fxInfo_citation: Pemstein et al. (2018, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2018:21); V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
fxInfo_clarification: Disadvantage refers to socioeconomic disadvantage. Specifically, in order to be considered disadvantaged members of a social group must have an average income that is significantly below the median national income.
fxInfo_cross_coder_aggregation: Bayesian Item Response Theory Measurement Model
fxInfo_notes: As of December 2014, category 0: There are no disadvantaged groups in the society, is coded as a separate variable (v2lgdsadlobin).
fxInfo_question: Considering all disadvantaged social groups in the country, how well represented are these groups, as a whole, in the national legislature?

fxInfo_responses.value: They have no representation at all.
They are highly under-represented relative to their proportion of the general population.
They are slightly under-represented relative to their proportion of the general population.
They are represented roughly equal relative to their proportion of the general population.
They are over-represented relative to their proportion of the general population.

fxInfo_scale: Ordinal, converted to interval by the measurement model
name: v2lgdsadlo, *_osp, *_ord
